datafield.subfield: Ḥawāshin ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-mashhūr li-Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ,
From label on fore-edge flap and edgetitle:
160 x 90 (110 x 55) mm. bound to 162 x 110 mm.
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 151
Origin: As appears in colophon on fol.181b (p.362), completed in 978 [1570 or 1571]. Name of copyist is not supplied.
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No.37. Glosses on Talkhis al-Miftah."

Binding: Pasteboards coverd in brown leather (pebble grained appearance of shagreen) over marbled paper ; Type II binding (with flap) ; doublures and interior of foreedge and envelope flaps in red leather ; upper and lower cover bear a simple rule-border consisting of a series of gold-painted fillets, better preserved on the flap ; in fair condition with abrasion, some tears, repairs to spine, and loose sewing.

Support: non-European (?) laid paper with laid lines barely visible, running horizontally and spaced roughly 9 laid lines per cm., chain lines barely visible, running vertically and irregularly spaced though occasionally 25 mm. apart, many inclusions and undissolved fibers, rather thin, and burnished ; flyleaves are in a different European laid paper with partial watermarks "Tosco..." [?] and six pointed star.
Decoration: Simple frame consisting of a gold band framed by black fillets ; text rubricated with keywords such as "قوله", chapter headings and overlinings in red.
Script: Naskh / Nastaʻlīq ; entire ms. in same Persian (?) hand ; sans serif and characteristic sloping of words to baseline ; fully pointed to convention.
Layout: Written in 17 lines per page.

Collation: i, IV (8), II (12), 5 IV (52), II+1 (57), III (63), V (73), IV (81), III+1 (88), 10 IV (168), IV+1 (177), II (181), i ; mainly quaternians ; middle of the quire marks resembling circles and occasionally the letter "ه" ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals (supplied during cataloguing).
Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, reads: "وتمت بعون الله وحسن توفيقه شهور سنة ثماني سبعين وتسعماية ... صلى الله عليه وآله وعترته الطاهرين م م م"
Explicit: "قوله ومثل الخيفاء ويقال فرس أخيف اذا كان احدى عينيه زرقاء والاخرى سوداء ومثل الرقطا[ء] قوله الرقط سواد شوبه نقط بياض يقال دجاجة رقطاء"
Incipit: "وبعد فهذه حواش على الشرح المشهور لتلخيص المفتاح كنت قد قيدتها عليه مجملة حال ما قراه عليه بعض احبتي فسألوني بعد امد ان افصلها لهم وأنقدها ففعلت ذلك مستعينا بالله..."

al-Jurjānī's glosses on the longer commentary of al-Taftāzānī (d.1389?) upon Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ by Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Qazwīnī (d. 739/1338), an abridgment of the third part of Miftāḥ al-ʻulūm by al-Sakkākī (d. 626/1229), on ʻIlm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān. Description provided by Maxim Romanov.
Acquired by purchase along with Abdul Hamid Collection (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on inner front cover, "No.37. Glosses on Talkhis al-Miftah." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "451" in Western numerals on recto of front flyleaf ; on a light green paper pasted to fol.1a (p.1) a detailed waqf statement in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh Adīb (Abdullah Edip), known as Jannatʹzādah (Cennet-zade), qāḍī of Erzurum, accompanied by his seal, reads: "وقفت وقفا صحيحا شرعيا بشرط أن لا يخرج من بيت الكتب الملتصق بداري الا لعلماء سكنوا بأرضروم بكفيل مرعى أورهن قوى و أنا الفقير اليه عز شانه السيد عبدالله أديب الشهير بجنتزاده القاضي بمدينة أرضروم في سنة اثنى وستين ومأتين وألف"; statement of sale on fol.1b (p.2) is dated ١٢٣٥ and situated in Erzurum, accompanied by circular seal impression in black ink with inscription reading "حسبي الله ونعم الوكيل السيد يحيى اسمعيل [؟] ..."; several other statements of sale and ownership marks on fol.1a-1b (p.1-2), including several seal impressions : illegible almond-shaped seal impression in black ink, scalloped almond-shaped seal impression in brownish ink, oval seal impression in black ink with inscription in nastaʻlīq, oval seal impression in black ink with inscription in thuluth ; occasional glosses, many marked with numeral ١٢ and name of sūrah ; many marginal corrections, some with accompanying signes-de-renvoi in a v-shape resembling a bird.
حواش علي الشرح المشهور لتلخيص المفتاح,
